properties.feesApplyText:
PERMITTED PAYMENTS - ASSURED SHORTHOLD TENANCIES

Before the Tenancy

Holding Deposit
1 Weeks Rent

Security Deposit (Tenancy Deposit) If the agreed rent is less than £50,000 per annum a deposit equivalent to five weeks rent is required. Should the agreed rent be in excess of £50,000 per annum then a deposit equivalent to six weeks rent is required.

During the Tenancy

Variation of the Tenancy Agreement
If the Tenant requests any changes to the Tenancy Agreement and the Landlord agrees to such changes, Hurford Salvi Carr reserves the right to charge up to £50 to administer each variation of the Tenancy Agreement. Should our reasonable costs exceed £50 we will notify the Tenant in advance.

Late Payment of Rent
Hurford Salvi Carr reserves the right to charge 3% above the prevailing Bank of England base rate on any late payment of rent after 14 days have passed.

Replacement of Keys or Security Devices
Should the Tenant lose, misplace or damage any keys or security devices, Hurford Salvi Carr reserves the right to charge up to £50 or all reasonably costs incurred for replacement of the keys / security devices.

Assignment of the Tenancy Agreement
Should the Landlord agree to a change of Tenant, the outgoing Tenant will be responsible for all reasonable costs incurred by Hurford Salvi Carr and/or the Landlord in consideration of administering the request.

Early Termination of the Tenancy
Should the Landlord agree to an early termination of the Tenancy, the Tenant will be responsible for any financial loss suffered by the Landlord and all reasonable costs incurred by Hurford Salvi Carr in consideration of administering the early termination.

TENANT PROTECTION

Hurford Salvi Carr is a member of ARLA Propertymark which is a client money protection scheme, and also a member of The Property Ombudsman which is a redress scheme. You can find out more details on our website .hurford-salvi-carr.co.uk or by contacting us directly.
properties.formattedBranchName: by Hurford Salvi Carr, Britton Street

properties.feesApplyText:
OpenRent is the UK's largest letting agent, using online services to make renting properties cheaper and more convenient than ever before - while holding quality and security as our top priorities.

OpenRent has never charged any administration or agency fees.

Under the Tenant Fees Act 2019, landlords may charge you a fee if you lose keys or other security devices, or pay your rent late. You may also be asked for other permitted payments, such as a holding deposit when you begin your application.

There are no hidden fees or other charges when renting an OpenRent property.

OpenRent is a proud member of the Property Ombudsman and holds comprehensive Client Money Protection via the government-authorised Client Money Protect scheme.

OpenRent is a registered agent in Scotland with registration number LARN1809026 and is a member of RentSmart Wales with license number #LR-75033-48352.

properties.feesApplyText:
Prior to your Tenancy

Once an offer has been accepted, preliminary monies equivalent to one or two weeks rent is payable which if you successfully enter into a tenancy agreement will be credited towards your Advance Rent.

Rent is payable in advance for each tenancy. You will therefore need to pay, as a minimum, the first months rent prior to the commencement of your tenancy, although the amount payable may differ dependent on the terms of your tenancy.

Deposit: This is the equivalent of 5 weeks rent (if the annual rent is less than £50,000) or 6 weeks rent (if the annual rent is £50,000 or more), payable prior to the commencement of your tenancy.

Other fees - Assured Shorthold Tenancies

Interest on late payment of rent will be charged at a rate of 3% per annum over The Bank of England s base lending rate. This will not be levied until the rent is more than 14 days late.

Lost keys or other security devices: In the event that any keys or other security devices are lost and need to be replaced, you will be required to pay the costs of replacing them. If the loss results in locks needing to be changed, you will be required to pay the actual costs of a locksmith, new lock and replacement keys for the tenant, landlord any other persons requiring keys. If extra costs are incurred there will be a charge of £15 per hour (inc. VAT) for the time taken replacing lost key(s) or other security device(s).

Contract variation, novation, amendment or change of occupant at the tenants request within an existing tenancy a contract fee of £50 (inc. VAT), will be payable by the tenant. All requests will be subject to the landlords consent and approval.

In the event that you wish to leave your contract early, you will be required to pay the landlord s costs in re-letting the property as well as all rent, council tax and utilities due under the tenancy until the start date of the replacement tenancy. The costs will be no more than the maximum amount of rent outstanding on the tenancy.

Other fees - Non-Assured Shorthold Tenancies

Tenancy agreement fee: £300 (inc. VAT) payable by the tenant after your offer has been accepted and we have proceeded to draw up a tenancy agreement. Reference fee for each Tenant: £60 (inc. VAT), payable when you have agreed to undergo the independent referencing process.

Right to rent check only: £30 (inc.VAT), payable by each occupier in circumstances where a full reference (as above) is not required.

In most lets, the tenant will be responsible for paying the inventory check in costs prior to the commencement of a tenancy. The cost is approximately £100- £250 depending on the size of the property.

Renewal agreement fee: £150 (inc. VAT) payable by the tenant upon renewal, should you and your landlord mutually agree to renew the tenancy for a further term.

Late rental payment or unpaid cheques: £30.00 (inc. VAT) will be payable by the tenant in respect of late rental payments or cheques that are returned unpaid. Interest on late payment of rent will also be charged in accordance with the terms as stated in the tenancy agreement, usually at a rate of 5% per annum over The Bank of England s base lending rate.

A tenancy swap fee of £420 (inc. VAT) will be payable by the tenant, together with a reference fee of £60 (inc. VAT) per tenant and / or Guarantor. Tenancy Swaps are subject to the landlord s consent and reference approval.

A variation of contract fee of £50 (inc. VAT) will be payable by the tenant. Variation of contract is subject to the landlords consent.

Additional Information

Chestertons is a member of ARLA.
Chestertons is a member of the Propertymark client money protection scheme.
Chestertons is a member of The Property Ombudsman redress scheme and subscribes to its Code of Practice.
properties.formattedBranchName: by Chestertons Estate Agents, Islington Lettings

properties.summary: Upon entering the property, you will be greeted by a modern white gloss kitchen with sleek under-counter lighting and a built-in fridge. The kitchen is fully equipped with all the essential appliances you need to cook up a storm. Moving through to the lounge, you'll find a bright and spacious...
properties.displayAddress: Wynford Road, Angel / Kings Cross N1
properties.feesApplyText:
Black Katz Fees

Before the tenancy starts (payable to Black Katz Lettings)

  • Holding deposit: 1 week's rent (this will be deducted from the first month's rent)
  • Deposit: 5 week's rent if the annual rent is less than £50,000, and six weeks? otherwise.

During the tenancy (payable to Agent)

  • Payment of £50 (inclusive of VAT) if you want to change the tenancy agreement
  • Payment for any unpaid rent or other reasonable costs associated with your early termination of the tenancy.
  • Default fees? for replacement of loss of keys or security device from £6 for a Yale up to £300 for security devices. ( payable to Agent / Landlord).
  • Payment of interest for the late payment of rent at a rate of 3% ( payable Agent / Landlord) above the Bank of England base rate.

Fees for Company Let

  • Fees for Company Let Set Up Cost and Referencing £500 inclusive of VAT
  • Administration Renewal fee of £500 inc V.A.T. to cover preparation of new legal contracts (not applicable on periodic tenancies) and re-referencing Tenant(s), where applicable.

Fees for Commom Law Agreements

  • Set up Fee of £145 inc V.A.T. per person to cover the preparation of all legal documentation and tenancy negotiations. Please note the set up fee on Managed Properties is £170 inc V.A.T. per person.
  • Reference Fee of £80 inc V.A.T. per person to cover the processing of collecting and checking of work, bank, and previous landlord references and collection of monies and provision of move-in packs.
  • Credit Check Fee payable to external credit agency from £25.00 inc V.A.T. and you will be notified prior to the Offer being submitted to the landlord if this is applicable.
  • Guarantor Fee £50 inc V.A.T. (per Guarantor ( if required)
  • Administration Renewal fee of £155 inc V.A.T. per person to cover preparation of new legal contracts (not applicable on periodic tenancies) and re-referencing Tenant(s) where applicable.
  • Administration Change of Tenant fee of £225 inc V.A.T. per person for ingoing Tenant.
  • To cover referencing of new tenants, preparation of all necessary legal paperwork and liaising with all existing Tenant(s). In addition there is a Contract Breakage Penalty of £240 inc V.A.T. per Tenant payable by the outgoing Tenant.
  • Default fees? for replacement of loss of keys or security device from £6 for a Yale up to £300 for security devices. ( payable to Agent / Landlord).
  • Payment of interest for the late payment of rent at a rate of 3% ( payable Agent / Landlord) above the Bank of England base rate.

During the tenancy (payable to the provider) if permitted, and applicable

  • Utilities - Gas, Electricity and Water
  • Communications - telephone and broadband
  • Installation of cable/satellite
  • Television licence
  • Council Tax

Redress scheme provided by: Safe Agent Accreditation: Number A3469

Client Money Protection provided by: Safe Agent Client Protection Scheme

Black Katz is a member of NALS (Client Money Protect), which is a client money protection scheme, and also a member of The Property Ombudsman which is a redress scheme. You can find out more details on the agent's website or by contacting the agent directly.

properties.summary: Spanning over 900 sq ft, this light filled two bedroom, two bathroom apartment is situated on the fourth floor of this popular development, moments from the Regents Canal and within easy access of Angel Underground.
